title: Ohms law - current from 5 V and 2 ohms

content.question: What is the current in a <math alttext="2.0 ohm" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Î©</mi></math> resistor when a potential difference of <math alttext="5.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> is applied across the resistor?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.10 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.40 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="2.5 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="10 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2.5 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
